original: Egge, Lars Hjalmar Bernhard, skådespelare, teaterchef, Göteborg, f. 25/ 9/94 i Sthlm av mål :mäst. Lars Ahl-ström o. Charlotta Dahlberg. G. 1. 21-27 m. Sonja Looft; 2. 28 m. Maja Cassel i h. andra gifte; 3. 40 m. operasång. Isa Quensel. Barn: Ingrid f. 41, Peter 44. — Stud. i måln. v. tekn. sk. 09-11, samtid, teaterstud. f. Louise Fahlman, sångstud. f. Martin Oscar o. Gillis Bratt, sångstud. i Tyskl. 22-23. Anst. h. Collijn v. Intima teatern 15-17, i landsorten 17-20,. i Finl. 20-22, ans’t. v. Hippodromen i Malmö 23-25, v. 0’scarsteatern 25-30, v. Stora teatern i Gbg 30-32, olika gästspel i Sv:e, Finl. o. Norge, teaterledare o. regissör v. Oscarsteatern 32-35, v. Stora teatern i Gbg 35-36, ledare f. Folkparker- nas operett somr. 35-46, chef f. Stora taatern i Gbg 38-47. De mani. huv:-rollerna i Orloff, Ökensången, Läderlappen, Cirkusprinsessan, Csàrdàsfur-stinnan. Glada änkan m. fl. Som film-skådesp. medv. i bl. a. filmerna Flottans hlla fästmö o. En melodi om våren. Hobby: målning. RVO.
translated: Egge, Lars Hjalmar Bernhard, actor, theater manager, Gothenburg, b. September 25, 1894 in Stockholm to painter Lars Ahlström and Charlotta Dahlberg. Married 1st to Sonja Looft from 1921-1927, 2nd to Maja Cassel in his second marriage in 1928, and 3rd to opera singer Isa Quensel in 1940. Children: Ingrid b. 1941, Peter b. 1944. Prior to his acting career, Egge studied painting at a technical school from 1909-1911, then studied theater with Louise Fahlman and singing with Martin Oscar and Gillis Bratt. He also studied singing in Germany from 1922-1923. Egge was employed by Collijn at the Intima Theater from 1915-1917, worked in regional theaters from 1917-1920, worked in Finland from 1920-1922, was employed at the Hippodrome in Malmo from 1923-1925, worked at Oscarsteatern from 1925-1930, worked at Stora Teatern in Gothenburg from 1930-1932, had various guest roles in Sweden, Finland, and Norway, was a theater director and producer at Oscarsteatern from 1932-1935, worked again at Stora Teatern from 1935-1936, was the leader of the Folkparkernas operetta summer program from 1935-1946, and was the manager of the Stora Teatern in Gothenburg from 1938-1947. He held lead roles in productions such as Orloff, The Desert Song, The Bat, The Circus Princess, and The Merry Widow. Egge also acted in films such as Flottans hulla fästmö and En melodi om våren. His hobby was painting and he was awarded the RVO.

structured.name: Lars Hjalmar Bernhard Egge
structured.description: Lars Hjalmar Bernhard Egge was a Swedish actor and theater manager who was born on September 25, 1894, in Stockholm.
